content: since there are now countless or many cryptoartists who represent their own style in the form of bitcoin relevant artworks i would like to know from you which cryptoartist are your favorites and why? also i would be very happy if you are also in possession of some artworks of your said favorite artists which you would then kindly show us herei personally have 2 favorite artists ... one comes from mexico, is most likely one of the most famous BTC artists and is called Lucho Poletti and the other comes from germany and is called mx12.levins. i already own some artworks from both artists which you can admire here nowQuote from: cygan on September 14, 2020, 04:56:32 PM✂Cryptoartwork - 'I Am Bitcoiner!' in 60x90 signed by Mx12.Levins #1/12 inclusive COA and the NFT editionCryptoartwork - 'BITCOIN HUMANITY!' (error print) in 60x60 signed by Mx12.Levins #1/12 inclusive COA and the NFT editionCryptoartwork - 'NO PRESSURE!' in 60x84 signed by Mx12.Levins #1/12 inclusive COANEWCryptoartwork - 'BITCOIN PIZZA DAY! 2022' in 39x49 signed by Mx12.Levins #2/24 inclusive COANEWCryptoartwork - 'Super Satoshi Origin Story' in 60x60 signed by Lucho Poletti #17/21 inclusive COACryptoartwork - 'CAST YOUR VOTE' in 50x40 by Lucho PolettiCryptoartwork - 'Dr. Satoshi's Orange Pill (German Edition)' in 23,4x30 (acrylic panel) by Lucho Poletti #01/04 inclusive COACryptoartwork - 'Big Lub' in 20x30 (acrylic panel) by Lucho Poletti #02/04 inclusive COACryptoartwork - 'Moneta Divina: Intervention' in 60x60 by Lucho Poletti #02/21 inclusive COACryptoartwork - 'Sound Money' in 30x30 (acrylic panel) by Lucho Poletti #02/10 inclusive COANEWCryptoartwork - 'Cypher Deos Full Canvas Set' in 100x267 by Lucho Poletti #02/09 inclusive COANEWNEWCryptoartwork - 'Satoshi El Gigante' in 20x30 (acrylic panel) by Lucho Poletti #02/04 inclusive COANEW✂in the LP artworks i always like the 'anonymous mask' and how the artist shows in detail the history of the BTC with all the colors and the detail on the pictures.with the paintings of mx12.levins I find the streetsytle very successful and also here you can see the high quality of the work

comments.author: franky1
comments.created_time: July 07, 2022, 08:26:07 PMLast edit: July 07, 2022, 09:02:01 PM by franky1
comments.body: though most of the art is sending a message. each person has different preferences.for me art has to send a message/story but also be very detailed,  where there is so much going on that it surprises you every time you see it by noticing something new, even after looking at it multiple timesthis is a good example of what i mean about the detail stuff where lots of things are happening where you notice new things every time (the middle and right canvas's)also i see a alot more effort and time and work went into these styles of art so id be willing if i ever bought art to put more money towards art like this compared to the simple "poster" format art.. but thats just my preference and thoughtsi know others like ones that are more 'poster' form where its a simple in your face message.. each to their own i say. art is for those viewing it. everyone has different tastes.as for the 'simple message' format artworks i personally prefer the ones where the message is not a word format (like a poster) but using symbolic imagery using known common reference/trends.. EG(note this is not commissioned artwork. its a quick mock display to show a demo of a message without words)

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: @franky1 i totally agree. but not only the right and middle canvas clearly shows a story but the whole painting tells a great story and is, like other artworks by Lucho Poletti also nice to look at with the augmented reality (ar) app

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on July 07, 2022, 08:36:56 PM@franky1 i totally agree. but not only the right and middle canvas clearly shows a story but the whole painting tells a great story and is, like other artworks by Lucho Poletti also nice to look at with the augmented reality (ar) app yea i wasnt dissing the other slates of canvas of the piece. i was just demonstrating my personal preference of if i was to look at something more then once. i prefer to have it be alive with lots of things to keep my interest. the other pieces do have value and show talent. its more of my preference of preferring seeing the details in things and finding new things within the detail.  that said. other pieces can peak my interest if the message is subtle or not so much in your face but takes you a bit to think about the meaning. even for a few secondsi know each piece means different things to different people. and some do just want to have a motivational BANG in your face thing. so as said, each piece of art has its values(features and benefits) to whomever views it from their own prospective

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Surprised no one mentioned Pascal Boyart yet. His Hal Finney art made up of torn-up dollar bills is one of the most iconic Bitcoin-related art in my opinion.https://twitter.com/pascalboyart/status/1062468996488986624/photo/1

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on July 08, 2022, 06:32:37 AMSurprised no one mentioned Pascal Boyart yet. His Hal Finney art made up of torn-up dollar bills is one of the most iconic Bitcoin-related art in my opinion.I thought that he was only known for his murals, which are really something that decorates the streets of many cities and I personally like them much more than the art paintings that someone buys and keeps in his private collection. I remember this artist because he has a profile on this forum and I know that I posted in some of his first threads.Besides Hal Finney, there are identical portraits of Dorian Nakamoto & Nick Szabo.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: I would vouch for Poletti as well, but predominantly for the artwork without text but just hidden symbols and meanings.  I find mysterious artwork to be the most fascinating for me compared to basic artwork like an object with a phrase around it.  On the other hand, the latter is more 'dumb-proof' as in they can be understood without much thinking and contemplation.  Maybe for interior design of a bar a text artwork may fit more.  It is like a T-Shirt, you get the idea and the meaning way faster than contemplating secrets of a mysterious art.-Regards,PrivacyG

comments.body: ^^Yeah, quite pleased to have met Pascal on forum, he went on to do some interviews and then introduced us to his wider network of Bitcoin artists, also very cool people and actually artistic...  Offence meant to the majority of NFT artists heh. Nanu Berks was another we interviewed after they did an exhibit in France, Argentinian IIRC. Also to note they were part of a broader movement back then (the yellow jackets in France) so I dig those kinds of art and activism. And Bitcoin spoke loudly for them.
